question: Which is the most produced silk variety in India?
explanation: India is the second-largest producer of silk in the world. Among the four varieties of silk produced in India, Mulberry accounts for 71.8% (20,434 MT), Tasar 9.9% (2,818 MT), Eri 17.8% (5,054 MT) and Muga 0.6% (166 MT) of the total raw silk production of 28,472 MT.
